intro: Hieracium neroikense, commonly known as the Neroikene hawkweed, is a flowering plant species native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Hieracium neroikense is often found in areas with well-drained soils and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
